itemDescription: English Independent minister and Hebrew scholar

wikipedia_page.main: Benjamin Boothroyd (1768 – 8 September 1836) was an English Independent minister and Hebrew scholar. He had the degrees of D.D. and L.L.D.

response: * Benjamin Boothroyd, English clergyman and Hebrew scholar

*The History of the Ancient Borough of Pontefract by Benjamin Boothroyd, printed by and for the author, 1807 details Sir Richard Hutton, the younger's involvement in the sieges of Pontefract Castle during the English Civil War and his death at the battle of Sherburn-in-Elmet.
|Timothy Priestley under Scott; William Vint under Walker at Northowram. Benjamin Boothroyd at Northowram.
